intro: Crypsinus pingpiensis, commonly known as the Pingpien stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to China. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant features fleshy, thick leaves that are typically green with a bluish or purplish hue. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are often pink or white, blooming in late spring or early summer. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species in its native habitat.
